reviews.text: Casa Sayrach is one of the many examples of Catalan Modernism on Avinguda Diagonal. This building lies at the corner between Enric Granados Street and Diagonal Avenue. Built in 1918, it was designed by Gabriel Borrell and a late example of Modernism. The influences of Gaudi are pretty clear. The exterior is like a simplified version of Casa Mila, but the Gauidi influences is much more obvious inside the building with it’s ornately walls and field taking it’s cue from nature. Sadly, I could only admire the building from the outside and a little of the interior as it’s a private building.

Casa Sayrach is a modernista building, but one of the last, built in 1918.
The building was designed by Gabriel Borrell and built by Manuel Sayrach.
Casa Sayrach hasn't overwhelming many datails, like many other modernista buildings.
Casa Sayrach is more simple and classy, and it is a graceful building.
